org.minijson.parser.policy

Interface ParserPolicy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractParserPolicy, DefaultParserPolicy

    public interface ParserPolicy
    A "strategy" for parsing options. Currently, it's only minimally used in the default parser implementations. (That is, most flag values are false, by default.)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean allowEmptyObjectMemberValue()
      If set to true, then when value in "key:value" is missing, it is treated as null.
      boolean allowExtraCommas()
      If true, we allow repeated commas in object/array (e.g., "[a, ,b]") Note: we have two choices when that happens.
      boolean allowLeadingJsonMarker()
      If true, we allow the special character sequence "???" (TBD) before the first "{" or "[".
      boolean allowNonObjectOrNonArray()
      If true, JSON string which is not object or array can still be parsed.
      boolean allowTrailingComma()
      If true, we allow a trailing comma at the end of object/array.
      boolean caseInsensitiveLiterals()
      If true, then literals are case-folded.
      boolean isStrirct()
      "Master" flag.

    • Method Detail

      • isStrirct

        boolean isStrirct()
        "Master" flag. If true, all other options are ignored.
        Returns:
        whether the parsing should be "strict" or "lenient".

      • allowNonObjectOrNonArray

        boolean allowNonObjectOrNonArray()
        If true, JSON string which is not object or array can still be parsed.
        Returns:
        true if we allow non object/array top-level node.

      • allowLeadingJsonMarker

        boolean allowLeadingJsonMarker()
        If true, we allow the special character sequence "???" (TBD) before the first "{" or "[". (I thought I saw something about this special marker to avoid json array exploitation from GET. But, I cannot remember what that was.... For now, we use this flag to allow *any* arbitrary chars before "{" or "[".)
        Returns:
        true if we allow special marker sequence.

      • allowTrailingComma

        boolean allowTrailingComma()
        If true, we allow a trailing comma at the end of object/array. Note that we do NOT allow a leading comma.
        Returns:
        true, if we allow an extra comma after the last element/member of object/array.

      • allowExtraCommas

        boolean allowExtraCommas()
        If true, we allow repeated commas in object/array (e.g., "[a, ,b]") Note: we have two choices when that happens. (1) [a,,b] can be interpreted as [a,null,b], or (2) [a,,b] can be interpreted as [a,b]. We adopt the second approach. Note that if allowExtraCommas==true, then allowTrailingComma should be true as well. But, not the other way around. (Again, we do not allow a leading commas(s) regardless of this flag.)
        Returns:
        true if we interpret repeated/consecutive commas as a single comma.

      • allowEmptyObjectMemberValue

        boolean allowEmptyObjectMemberValue()
        If set to true, then when value in "key:value" is missing, it is treated as null. (Currently, not being used.)
        Returns:
        true if we allow a missing value in an object member.

      • caseInsensitiveLiterals

        boolean caseInsensitiveLiterals()
        If true, then literals are case-folded. That is, null, Null, TRUE, etc. are all allowed.
        Returns:
        true if we ignore the case in literals, "null", "true", and "false".
